abstract: Bernard L. Madoff, who is serving a 150-year sentence in a federal prison in Butner, N.C., was moved to a low-security medical center at the prison, according to the Bureau of Prisons. It’s unclear why the 71-year-old was moved there from a medium-security facility, which also houses patients for routine medical examines before they are moved to a permanent cell.

lead_paragraph: Update | 4:31 p.m.  Bernard L. Madoff, who is serving a 150-year sentence in a federal prison in Butner, N.C., for running a vast Ponzi scheme, was moved to a low-security medical center at the prison last Friday, according to the Bureau of Prisons.

headline.main: Madoff Being Treated for High Blood Pressure
